identificationModule.briefTitle: Use of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) Coupled With Constraint Induced Movement Therapy in Stroke Patient
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effects of Transcranial DC Stimulation Coupled With Constraint Induced Movement Therapy on Motor Function in Stroke Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether noninvasive brain stimulation associated with motor learning offers an additional benefit than motor learning alone in patients with stroke.

The investigators hypothesis is that active transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) combined with constraint induced movement therapy (CIMT) will induce a greater motor function improvement as compared with sham tDCS combined with CIMT.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
In this 3 experiments study we will evaluate the effect of tDCS and constraint induced movement therapy (CIMT) in stroke patients (exp 1) as well as in healthy subjects (control population - exp 2). Finally we will investigate the effect of tACS - transcranial alternating current stimulation - as an alternative to tDCS, on motor function in healthy subjects (exp 3). The two experiments on tDCS are parallels (exp 1 \& 2), while the experiment on tACS uses a crossover design (exp 3).

For stroke patients (Exp1), our primary outcome measure is a clinical scale (Jebsen-Taylor Hand Function Test), while for healthy subjects (Exp 2) we investigate the effect of tDCS and CIMIT on cortico-spinal excitability using TMS - transcranial magnetic stimulation. Finally, for the third experiment using tACS, our primary outcome is cortical oscillation, as measured by EEG - electroencephalogram.

armGroups.label: active tDCS + CIMT - stroke patients
armGroups.description: Participants will receive 5 sessions of tDCS over the primary motor cortex (M1). We will use the following stimulation parameters: intensity of 1mA and for the first 40 minutes of constraint induced movement therapy (CIMT - 10 consecutive sessions Monday- Friday).

armGroups.label: active tDCS + CIMT - Healthy
armGroups.description: Participants will receive one session of tDCS over the primary motor cortex (M1). We will use the following stimulation parameters: intensity of 1mA and for the first 40 minutes of constraint induced movement therapy (CIMT)

armGroups.label: tACS - Healthy Subjects
armGroups.description: The investigators will have 40 healthy subjects who will undergo one session of treatment with active tACS (in which the order in which they receive either sham or active transcranial alternating current stimulation (tACS) stimulation will be randomized).

armGroups.label: sham tDCS + CIMT - stroke patients
armGroups.description: Participants will receive 5 sessions of tDCS over the primary motor cortex (M1). We will use the following stimulation parameters: intensity of 1mA and for the first 40 minutes of constraint induced movement therapy (CIMT - 10 consecutive sessions Monday- Friday). For the sham session, tDCS is turned off after 30seconds.

armGroups.label: sham tDCS + CIMT - Healthy
armGroups.description: Participants will receive one session of tDCS over the primary motor cortex (M1). We will use the following stimulation parameters: intensity of 1mA and for the first 40 minutes of constraint induced movement therapy (CIMT). The sham stimulation consists of 30 seconds of stimulation at the beginning of the 40 min of treatment.

armGroups.label: sham tACS - Healthy Subjects
armGroups.description: The investigators will have 40 healthy subjects who will undergo one day of treatment with sham tACS. All participants received active and sham stimulation in a randomized order.

interventions.name: transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS)
interventions.description: Subjects will be stimulated at 1 mA for 40 minutes.

interventions.name: transcranial alternating current stimulation (tACS)
interventions.description: Subjects will be stimulated at 15Hz for 20 minutes.

primaryOutcomes.description: Jebsen Taylor Hand Function Test: measures hand function in real-life activities, by evaluating the time required to perform 7 different tasks. We used the non-cronstrained hand for the assessments. The sum of the different tasks was used for the analysis.

Motor evoked potential (MEP) Using Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS), MEP were recorded before and after tDCS (both active and sham).

The percentage of change in MEP (post versus pre intervention) between the two groups (active and sham) were used for the comparison.

Recording took place in a dim-lighted room set up with acoustic and electric isolation. EEG was acquired from 64-channels HydroCel Geodesic Sensor Net (Electrical Geodesic Inc., Eugene, OH) and recorded using Net Station running on a MacIntosh G4 computer. Alpha power were used as the main outcome measure. The difference values (e.g., post minus pre tACS) were used for the analysis. The alpha frequency is a brain oscillation that takes place especially when subjects are in a relaxed state, especially eyes closed. In the motor cortex, a decrease in alpha power has been seen during motor performance. Therefore, it could be speculated that a decrease in power in this study would indicate more engagement in motor cortex during the motor performance.

references.citation: Elsner B, Kugler J, Pohl M, Mehrholz J. Transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) for improving activities of daily living, and physical and cognitive functioning, in people after stroke. Cochrane Database Syst Rev. 2020 Nov 11;11(11):CD009645. doi: 10.1002/14651858.CD009645.pub4.

groups.title: tDCS + CIMT - Stroke
groups.description:
Participants will receive tDCS over the primary motor cortex (M1). We will use the following stimulation parameters: intensity of 1mA and for the first 40 minutes of constraint induced movement therapy (CIMT- 10 consecutive sessions Monday- Friday).

Transcranial Stimulation: Subjects will be stimulated at 1 mA for 40 minutes.

groups.title: Sham tDCS + CIMT - Stroke
groups.description:
Participants will receive tDCS over the primary motor cortex (M1). We will use the following stimulation parameters: intensity of 1mA and for the first 40 minutes of constraint induced movement therapy (CIMT- 10 consecutive sessions Monday- Friday).

Sham stimulation consists of 30secondes of stimulation at the beginning of the 40minutes treatment.

groups.title: Healthy Participants: Active tDCS + Motor Training
groups.description: Each stimulation day will include up to six hours of training termed "shaping" in the non-dominant hand while the dominant hand is restrained in a resting hand splint and secured in a sling. At the start of this training, subjects will undergo 40 minutes of tDCS at 1mA.

groups.title: Healthy Participants: Sham tDCS + Motor Training
groups.description: Each stimulation day will include up to six hours of training termed "shaping" in the non-dominant hand while the dominant hand is restrained in a resting hand splint and secured in a sling. At the start of this training, subjects will undergo 40 minutes of sham tDCS.

groups.title: Healthy Participants - Active tACS, Then Sham
groups.description: Subjects will receive 20 min of active then sham tACS over the primary motor cortex in a randomized order.

groups.title: Healthy Participants - Sham tACS, Then Active
groups.description: Subjects will receive 20 min of sham and then tACS over the primary motor cortex in a randomized order.

groups.title: tDCS + CIMT - Stroke
groups.description:
Participants received active tDCS over the primary motor cortex (M1). We used the following stimulation parameters: intensity of 1mA and for the first 40 minutes of constraint induced movement therapy (CIMT- 10 consecutive sessions Monday- Friday).

Transcranial Stimulation: Subjects were stimulated at 1 mA for 40 minutes.

groups.title: Sham tDCS + CIMT - Stroke
groups.description: Participants received sham tDCS over the primary motor cortex plus CIMT. The same site and parameters of stimulation were employed, but the stimulator was turned off after 30 seconds of stimulation. This ensured that patients could feel the initial itching sensation at the beginning of tDCS.

groups.title: tDCS Active + CIMT - Healthy
groups.description: Participants received active (1mA - 40min) of the primary motor cortex (M1) bilaterally combined with unilateral motor training and contralateral hand restraint.

groups.title: Sham tDCS + CIMT - Healthy
groups.description: Participants received sham tDCS (1mA - 40min) of the primary motor cortex (M1) bilaterally combined with unilateral motor training and contralateral hand restraint.

groups.title: tACS Active&Sham - Healthy
groups.description: active or sham 15Hz-tACS over of the primary motor cortex (M1) bilaterally.

outcomeMeasures.title: Jebsen Taylor Hand Function Test
outcomeMeasures.description: Jebsen Taylor Hand Function Test: measures hand function in real-life activities, by evaluating the time required to perform 7 different tasks. We used the non-cronstrained hand for the assessments. The sum of the different tasks was used for the analysis.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The Jebsen Taylor Hand Function Test was only performed in the stroke study (Experiment 1).

groups.title: tDCS + CIMT
groups.description:
Participants will receive tDCS over the primary motor cortex (M1). We will use the following stimulation parameters: intensity of 1mA and for the first 40 minutes of constraint induced movement therapy (CIMT- 10 consecutive sessions Monday- Friday).

Transcranial Stimulation: Subjects will be stimulated at 1 mA for 40 minutes.

groups.title: Sham tDCS + CIMT
groups.description: Participants received sham tDCS over the primary motor cortex plus CIMT. The same site and parameters of stimulation were employed, but the stimulator was turned off after 30 seconds of stimulation. This ensured that patients could feel the initial itching sensation at the beginning of tDCS.

outcomeMeasures.title: Cortical Excitability
outcomeMeasures.description:
Motor evoked potential (MEP) Using Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS), MEP were recorded before and after tDCS (both active and sham).

The percentage of change in MEP (post versus pre intervention) between the two groups (active and sham) were used for the comparison.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The cortical excitability measurement (MEP) was performed in healthy participants involved in the tDCS+CIMT study (Experiment 2).

groups.title: Healthy Participants: Active tDCS + Motor Training
groups.description: Each stimulation day will include up to six hours of training termed "shaping" in the non-dominant hand while the dominant hand is restrained in a resting hand splint and secured in a sling. At the start of this training, subjects will undergo 40 minutes of tDCS at 1mA.

groups.title: Healthy Participants: Sham tDCS + Motor Training
groups.description: Each stimulation day will include up to six hours of training termed "shaping" in the non-dominant hand while the dominant hand is restrained in a resting hand splint and secured in a sling. At the start of this training, subjects will undergo 40 minutes of sham tDCS.

outcomeMeasures.title: Cortical Oscillations - EEG
outcomeMeasures.description: Recording took place in a dim-lighted room set up with acoustic and electric isolation. EEG was acquired from 64-channels HydroCel Geodesic Sensor Net (Electrical Geodesic Inc., Eugene, OH) and recorded using Net Station running on a MacIntosh G4 computer. Alpha power were used as the main outcome measure. The difference values (e.g., post minus pre tACS) were used for the analysis. The alpha frequency is a brain oscillation that takes place especially when subjects are in a relaxed state, especially eyes closed. In the motor cortex, a decrease in alpha power has been seen during motor performance. Therefore, it could be speculated that a decrease in power in this study would indicate more engagement in motor cortex during the motor performance.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The brain oscillations measurements were only performed in the tACS study (Experiment 3).

groups.title: Healthy Participants - Active tACS
groups.description: Subjects will receive 20 min of active tACS

groups.title: Healthy Participants - Sham tACS
groups.description: Subjects will receive 20 min of sham tACS
